items.summary: Bangkok says the two countries will return to the negotiating table this week amid claims the initial peace deal was rushed for Donald Trump.

items.title: Kyrgios not offered Australian Open wildcard as four other Aussies named
items.summary: After a career-best year, Queenslander Priscilla Hon was among four Australian Open wildcards named on Monday, but Nick Kyrgios was not among them.

items.title: Three bushwalkers rescued from Lake Rhona in Tasmania's south-west
items.summary: Three "cold and wet but otherwise uninjured" bushwalkers have been airlifted out of Tasmania's remote south-west after calling for help.

items.title: Man charged after death at Big 4 Port Willunga caravan park in Adelaide's south
items.summary: A 49-year-old man has appeared in court charged with the alleged murder of 72-year-old Gary Hallam at the Big 4 Port Willunga Tourist Park at Aldinga in Adelaide's south on Monday.

items.title: Festive season to bring Christmas Day heatwave to Perth and Cocos Island tropical cyclone
items.summary: Perth is expected to hit a high of 41 degrees on Christmas Day with the Cocos (Keeling) Islands bracing for a tropical cyclone that could intensify to a category two system.

items.title: Japan prepares to restart world's biggest nuclear plant, 15 years after Fukushima
items.summary: Japan has taken the final step to allow the world's largest nuclear power plant to resume operations with a regional vote in Niigata prefecture.

items.title: City Beach fined $14m by Federal Court over button battery safety breaches
items.summary: The Federal Court orders the fashion retailer to pay $14 million in fines after it was taken to court by the Australian Competition and Consumer Commission.

items.title: Queensland man arrested following dozens of antisemitic graffiti offences
items.summary: A Coolum Beach man is charged with 25 counts of wilful damage following a spate of antisemitic graffiti incidents.

items.title: Should I pour leftover liquids or foods down the sink?
items.summary: Ever been about to pour rancid milk down the sink and thought, "Hmm, maybe I shouldn't…"? What about the tomato passata that's gone off? Or the water you washed the paint in? Or that pungent oil from a tuna can?

items.title: Family tells inquest young mother 'died of a broken heart' as system failed to protect her
items.summary: The NSW Coroners Court hands down findings into the 2023 death of a young Indigenous mother after a doctor gave evidence the woman may have died from "broken-heart syndrome".

items.title: Stuart Broad still believes Australia's Ashes-winning team is their worst side in 15 years
items.summary: Stuart Broad has attracted plenty of criticism for his low opinion of the current Australian team but the England great stands by his harsh assessment.

items.title: Industry and musicians explore ways to make vinyl records more environmentally friendly
items.summary: Artists like Stella Donnelly are searching for ways to cut waste and make production of their albums environmentally friendly.

items.title: Why Mitchell Starc is open to playing on to the 2027 Ashes series
items.summary: Mitchell Starc will be 37 by the time the 2027 Ashes kicks off in 18 months' time, but the in-form quick is open to spearheading Australia's attack in their next clash with England.

items.title: Tasmanians in 1971 speak about legalising cannabis
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Royal commission into Bondi attack appears inevitable for Albanese government
items.summary: The prime minister is undoubtedly facing tough conversations behind closed doors, but until the public gets to witness the scrutiny he will never satisfy his critics.

items.title: Measles cases almost triple in Australia as global outbreaks continue
items.summary: The number of measles cases nationwide is now approaching triple the number of cases reported in 2024 as outbreaks continue around the world.

items.title: Bondi gunmen filmed 'firearms training' and threw explosives into crowd, court told
items.summary: The Bondi gunman accused of killing 15 people conducted "firearms training" in a regional area with his father and recorded a video about their "justification" for the attack, according to documents released by a Sydney court.

items.title: Children and staff abducted from Nigerian school released
items.summary: No group has claimed responsibility for the November 21 abduction of more than 300 children and staff from a Nigerian Catholic school.

items.title: Building a village means showing up even when it feels hard, says Esther Perel
items.summary: Building and maintaining a village doesn't just happen. It takes effort. It means showing up even when it feels hard or inconvenient, says psychotherapist Esther Perel.

items.title: Lake George hides an earthquake fault zone, and scientists are using your road noise to see it
items.summary: Almost 100 sensors beside the Federal Highway are helping build the clearest picture yet of the fault beneath the iconic lake.

items.title: Government confirms plans for gas reservation on east coast
items.summary: Chris Bowen makes a long-anticipated announcement about reserving a portion of gas on the east coast for domestic use after a cabinet meeting.

items.title: Seven injured as car crashes into Royal Hotel Capertee, near Lithgow
items.summary: A man has been charged after seven people were injured when a car crashed into a pub on the New South Wales central tablelands.

items.title: Former chief justice urges national Bondi terror attack royal commission
items.summary: Calls for the federal government to hold a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack continue after NSW announced intentions for a state-level royal commission, prompting some confusion about the difference.

items.title: School children have inspired art works which will be installed on wind turbines in WA's Goldfields.

items.title: Seven wind turbines provide unique canvas for Indigenous artist Sara Riches
items.summary: A renewable energy project being built at one of Western Australia's biggest gold mines has been transformed into a unique canvas for an Indigenous artist and about 200 schoolchildren.

items.title: Jenny Croom thought Portrait Artist of the Year was a scam — then she won it
items.summary: Jenny Croom put her art on hold for her family; now the 77-year-old has been crowned Australia's 2025 Portrait Artist of the Year.

items.title: Calls for urgent intervention to help Victorian teachers find affordable housing
items.summary: Victorian teachers say they are exhausted, living almost 100 kilometres from work, as their salaries fail to sustain housing costs.

items.title: James Ransone, star of The Wire and It: Chapter Two, dies at age 46
items.summary: James Ransone, an actor best known for playing Ziggy Sobotka in The Wire and also starring in It: Chapter Two, has died, according to LA medical authorities.

items.title: Seasonal workers claim unfair bonus cuts and poor conditions on NSW cherry orchard
items.summary: Ten pickers who worked at Hallmark Cherries' orchard in NSW complain about poorly maintained accommodation and failure to pay an end-of-season bonus.

items.title: Nikhil Chaudhary hits six out of Kardinia Park in match-winning BBL half-century for Hobart Hurricanes
items.summary: Hobart star Nikhil Chaudhary launches a ball onto the roof of Kardinia Park in Geelong, but his 79 off 38 is still not enough to earn him player of the match honours in the win over the Renegades.

items.title: Man arrested for knife possession at Christmas carols event in Launceston
items.summary: Police charge a man after he allegedly produced a 30-centimetre knife at a Christmas carols event in Launceston.

items.title: How your town can become a 'dementia-friendly' community
items.summary: The small Victorian town of Ouyen, 440 kilometres north-west of Melbourne, is known for its grain and sheep farms, but also for being "dementia friendly".

items.title: Man charged with murder after woman's death at Northfield
items.summary: A 42-year-old man has been charged with murder after a woman was found dead in a home in Adelaide's northern suburbs on Sunday night.

items.title: Heavily armed specialist police to patrol MCG during Boxing Day Test
items.summary: Officers from the Critical Incident Response Team armed with long-arm weapons will patrol outside the MCG during the upcoming Boxing Day Test.

items.title: High school students forced to fight false allegations of AI cheating
items.summary: Pulled out of class, held back after school and forced to prove they're not AI cheats, students say NSW high schools are pitting them against faulty AI detectors.

items.title: China Southern Airlines starts flying between Darwin and Guangzhou
items.summary: Direct flights between Darwin and China have resumed for the first time since the COVID-19 pandemic, bringing optimism of a tourism boom for the two countries.

items.title: Nathan Lyon and Pat Cummins likely out of Boxing Day Ashes Test with series secured
items.summary: Nathan Lyon's injury leaves selectors with another headache, made trickier by Pat Cummins's admission that he will almost certainly miss the Boxing Day Test now that the Ashes are won.

items.title: Welcome Christmas rain in the outback while south-east Queensland will be sweltering
items.summary: A tropical low will bring heavy rain and storms to much of Queensland this week while a south-east heatwave persists.

items.title: Christmas bonuses boost staff morale, but employers facing 'tighter margins' may struggle to give
items.summary: From hams to vouchers and cash, festive bonuses vary — but do they still have a place in the Australian workforce?

items.title: Given the all clear from cancer, 6yo Laylah celebrates by ringing the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital
items.summary: When six-year-old Laylah-Jane Morton rang the bell at the Queensland Children's Hospital, it marked the end of her chemotherapy treatment for blood cancer — and she had her merry band of eight siblings with her to help her celebrate.

items.title: Long-awaited wine industry mandatory code of conduct too late for growers
items.summary: After 20 years, three senate inquiries and an independent review, the sale of wine grapes will be regulated by a mandatory code of conduct, but growers say it might be too late.

items.title: US says it is intercepting third Venezuelan oil tanker amid simmering tensions
items.summary: If successful, it would be the third oil tanker seized as Donald Trump continues his campaign on President Nicolas Maduro.

items.title: England's Bazballers finally admit they've got things wrong in this Ashes series
items.summary: Losing an Ashes Test series in Australia is nothing new for England, but finally the Bazballers are looking inwards at their own failings after a stirring end to the Adelaide Test.

items.title: Insolvent business run by former AFL star wipes its debt of millions, and the taxpayer is left to foot the bill
items.summary: A digital marketing agency run by a former AFL star has wiped its millions in debt through an insolvency process, only to open under a new ABN days later. Former staff were left without a job and almost $450,000 in unpaid entitlements, but it's within the bounds of the law and leaves taxpayers footing the bill.

items.title: Doctors delay surgery for patients on GLP-1 drugs like Ozempic over increased risk of pulmonary aspiration
items.summary: Doctors say they are forced to delay some procedures due to the risk of serious consequences for patients on Ozempic-like drugs.

items.title: Calls for gun law reform clash with gun lobby resistance
items.summary: Straight-pull rapid-fire rifles, social media campaigns, and a looming buyback scheme – Australia's gun debate is reloading.

items.title: What we do and don't know about the Bondi gunmen's month in the Philippines
items.summary: The long shadow of the Bondi shooting has darkened the coastal southern Philippines, causing deep confusion and stoking long-held anxieties over terrorist groups in the region.

items.title: Staff at Melbourne building company say wages went unpaid as employer threw lavish parties
items.summary: Since 2017, Melbourne building boss Mike Harris has overseen four company collapses. Left behind are clients who have lost their life savings and staff who couldn't pay their mortgages.

items.title: Here's what defined Australian politics in 2025
items.summary: The ABC's political reporters, commentators and broadcasters reflect on what defined the year in politics.

items.title: Is 2025 ending with an AI bubble? We could be at a turning point in history
items.summary: What makes the AI-driven stock market bubble unique in history is that if it's not a bubble, the impact on humanity could be far more challenging than any previous technology.

items.title: Nine killed, 10 wounded in South African pub shooting
items.summary: The incident happened just before 1am local time at a licensed tavern in Johannesburg's Bekkersdal township.

items.title: Australia defeats words with actions to outclass England and romp to Ashes glory
items.summary: In the pre-series furore, with England crowing and injury concerns mounting, Australia stayed quiet. Its response has been an emphatic and quite brilliant Ashes domination.

items.title: Nathan Lyon's hamstring, Marnus Labuschagne's hands and Jamie Smith's hack — quick hits from day five of third Ashes Test
items.summary: Jamie Smith is pilloried as "a dope" after an ugly dismissal as Nathan Lyon is injured and Marnus Labuschagne creates more catching magic. Here are the quick hits from day five of the third Ashes Test in Adelaide.

items.title: How staying quiet led Pluribus to be one of the most talked about shows of 2025
items.summary: Pluribus, the new show from Breaking Bad and Better Call Saul creator Vince Gilligan, presents a life of perfect harmony — all you have to do is give up your individuality.

items.title: How a Reddit tip proved vital for uncovering the suspect of the Brown University shooting
items.summary: On December 13 a gunman killed two Brown University students and wounded nine others, escaping by foot.

items.title: Police investigate alleged daylight assault of woman at Burleigh Heads National Park
items.summary: Police are appealing for information after a woman was allegedly assaulted in broad daylight on a popular Gold Coast walking track.

items.title: Nathan Lyon injured on fifth day of Adelaide Test as England hunt a miracle to keep Ashes series alive
items.summary: The 38-year-old spinner pulls up lame after diving to save a boundary in the morning session of the fifth day of the third Ashes Test at Adelaide Oval.

items.title: NT government pulls funding for puberty blockers, gender-affirming hormones for children
items.summary: Northern Territory Health Minister Steve Edgington announces the withdrawal of public funding for puberty blockers and hormone treatments for children, labelling them "dangerous, ideologically driven practices".

items.title: After the Bondi attack, the contrast between Chris Minns and Anthony Albanese has been stark
items.summary: As Sydneysiders paid their respects to the Bondi terror victims, one moment captured the contrast between two Labor leaders and their perceived responses to antisemitism.

items.title: PM announces review of intelligence and law enforcement in wake of Bondi attack
items.summary: Former top bureaucrat Dennis Richardson is appointed to lead the review, which will report in April of next year.

items.title: US strikes kill at least five IS members in Syria, monitor says
items.summary: The operation employed more than 100 precision munitions targeting known IS infrastructure and weapons sites, according to a US Centcom statement.

items.title: Approaching her 80th birthday, Joan Jeffery is still riding high
items.summary: While many people entering their 80s are struggling with physical or mental limitations, Joan Jeffery still manages to do all the heavy lifting of caring for a horse.

items.title: Paraplegic engineer becomes the first wheelchair user to blast into space
items.summary: The flight was just 10 minutes but the capsule still managed to soar 105 kilometres up, skimming into space.

items.title: Nick Kyrgios handed wildcard into Brisbane International as his tennis return continues
